item.name: Government Operations and the Federal Workforce Subcommittee

item.title: A bill to repeal a requirement with respect to the procurement and acquisition of alternative fuels.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.text: Motion to Discharge Committee filed by Mr. Kuhl (NY). Petition No: 110-10. (Discharge petition text with signatures.)

item.name: Government Operations and the Federal Workforce Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Government Management, Organization, and Procurement.
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

On 6/24/2008, a motion was filed to discharge the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform from consideration of H.R. 5656. A discharge petition requires 218 signatures for further action.(Discharge Petition No. 110-10: text with signatures.)

summary.text: Amends the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 to repeal provisions prohibiting any federal agency from entering into a contract for procurement of an alternative or synthetic fuel for any mobility-related use, other than for research or testing, unless the contract specifies that the lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions associated with the production and combustion of the fuel must be less than or equal to such emissions from the equivalent conventional fuel.

bill.title: To repeal a requirement with respect to the procurement and acquisition of alternative fuels.

item.title: To repeal a requirement with respect to the procurement and acquisition of alternative fuels.
To repeal a requirement with respect to the procurement and acquisition of alternative fuels.

latestAction.text: Motion to Discharge Committee filed by Mr. Kuhl (NY). Petition No: 110-10. (Discharge petition text with signatures.)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
